title: Enhancing 21st-Century Citizenship Competencies Through Maker Education: Social Competency Self-Assessment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic maker activity experience and digital tool proficiency, foundational understanding of social competencies (collaboration, communication, citizenship), and basic concepts of social relationship formation
context.additional_context: Applying gamification and personalized learning design in project-based assessment environments, aiming to strengthen learners' citizenship and social relationship-building abilities. Particularly emphasizes collaborative activities for fostering community consciousness and creative approaches for solving social issues.

learning_goals: Learners can regularly self-assess 21st-century citizen competencies (creativity, collaboration, critical thinking) during maker project implementation

Learners utilize gamification elements (level-up, reward system) to establish a competency development plan at least three times weekly for two weeks, submit five or more reflective journals by course completion, and achieve 4 points or higher (5-point scale) in the motivation sustainability category from peer evaluations and instructor feedback

During a mid-term course (2-4 weeks), learners set one maker learning goal, execute three or more customized activities (design/production/testing) according to a weekly plan, and submit deliverables (prototype or report) and activity logs at course completion to verify meeting evaluation criteria (80%+ goal achievement). This measures effects on social relationship formation and citizenship enhancement

resources: Maker kit (3D pen, simple electronic components, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
